explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques, specifically XGBoost and LSTM, for default prediction in credit card users.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves supervised learning as it uses labeled data (default or non-default) to train the models.
explanations.classification: The research focuses on classifying credit card users into default or non-default categories.
explanations.neural network: LSTM is a type of neural network used in the study for time-series data analysis.
explanations.deep learning: The paper mentions the application of deep learning algorithms, specifically LSTM, in the financial field.
explanations.long short-term memory: LSTM is used in the study to analyze time-series information from transaction flow data.
explanations.LSTM: The paper explicitly mentions the use of LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) for analyzing time-series data in default prediction.
